entries.name: status
entries.desc: The three digit reply code of the SMTP response

entries.name: string
entries.desc: The human readable reply text of the SMTP response

entries.name: new(status, string)
entries.desc: Creates a new instance of the Response class and sets the status and string attributes

entries.name: parse(str)
entries.desc: Parses the received response and separates the reply code and the human readable reply text

entries.name: capabilities()
entries.desc: Returns a hash of the human readable reply text in the response if it is multiple lines. It does not return the first line. The key of the hash is the first word the value of the hash is an array with each word thereafter being a value in the array

entries.name: continue?()
entries.desc: Determines whether the response received was a Positive Intermediate reply (3xx reply code)

entries.name: cram_md5_challenge()
entries.desc: Creates a CRAM-MD5 challenge. You can view more information on CRAM-MD5 on Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CRAM-MD5

entries.name: exception_class()
entries.desc: Determines whether there was an error and raises the appropriate error based on the reply code of the response

entries.name: message()
entries.desc: The first line of the human readable reply text

entries.name: status_type_char()
entries.desc: Takes the first digit of the reply code to determine the status type

entries.name: success?()
entries.desc: Determines whether the response received was a Positive Completion reply (2xx reply code)
